post.description:
Activates failover for the specified workspace.

The specified replication location must match the location of the enabled replication for this workspace. The failover operation is asynchronous and can take up to 30 minutes to complete. The status of the operation can be checked using the operationId returned in the response.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description:
Deactivates failover for the specified workspace.

The failback operation is asynchronous and can take up to 30 minutes to complete. The status of the operation can be checked using the operationId returned in the response.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

The name is kept for 14 days and cannot be used for another workspace. To remove the workspace completely and release the name, use the force flag.

post.description:
Purges data in an Log Analytics workspace by a set of user-defined filters.

In order to manage system resources, purge requests are throttled at 50 requests per hour. You should batch the execution of purge requests by sending a single command whose predicate includes all user identities that require purging. Use the in operator to specify multiple identities. You should run the query prior to using for a purge request to verify that the results are expected.
Log Analytics only supports purge operations required for compliance with GDPR. The Log Analytics product team reserves the right to reject requests for purge operations that are not for the purpose of GDPR compliance. In the event of a dispute, please create a support ticket

202.description: Accepted request for purging an Log Analytics workspace.

x-ms-status-location.description: The location from which to request the operation status.

Value should be in the following format: 'param-name1:type1 = default_value1, param-name2:type2 = default_value2'. For more examples and proper syntax please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions.

Operation.title: REST API Operation
Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

capacityReservationLevel.description: The capacity reservation level in GB for this workspace, when CapacityReservation sku is selected.

lastSkuUpdate.description: The last time when the sku was updated.

WorkspaceCapping.description: The daily volume cap for ingestion.

dailyQuotaGb.description: The workspace daily quota for ingestion.

quotaNextResetTime.description: The time when the quota will be rest.

dataIngestionStatus.description: The status of data ingestion for this workspace.

values.description: Ingestion enabled following daily cap quota reset, or subscription enablement.
Ingestion started following service setting change.
Ingestion stopped following service setting change.
Reached daily cap quota, ingestion stopped.
Ingestion stopped following suspended subscription.
80% of daily cap quota reached.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the workspace.

customerId.description: This is a read-only property. Represents the ID associated with the workspace.

retentionInDays.description: The workspace data retention in days. Allowed values are per pricing plan. See pricing tiers documentation for details.

workspaceCapping.description: The daily volume cap for ingestion.

publicNetworkAccessForIngestion.description: The network access type for accessing Log Analytics ingestion.

publicNetworkAccessForQuery.description: The network access type for accessing Log Analytics query.

forceCmkForQuery.description: Indicates whether customer managed storage is mandatory for query management.

privateLinkScopedResources.description: List of linked private link scope resources.

defaultDataCollectionRuleResourceId.description: The resource ID of the default Data Collection Rule to use for this workspace. Expected format is - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Insights/dataCollectionRules/{dcrName}.

enableDataExport.description: Flag that indicate if data should be exported.

immediatePurgeDataOn30Days.description: Flag that describes if we want to remove the data after 30 days.

enableLogAccessUsingOnlyResourcePermissi.description: Flag that indicate which permission to use - resource or workspace or both.

clusterResourceId.description: Dedicated LA cluster resourceId that is linked to the workspaces.

unifiedSentinelBillingOnly.description: An indication if the specify workspace is limited to sentinel's unified billing model only.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.
The principal id of user assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client id of user assigned identity.

resourceId.description: The full resource Id of the private link scope resource.

scopeId.description: The private link scope unique Identifier.

PrivateLinkScopedResource.description: The private link scope resource reference.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the replication is enabled or not. When true, workspace configuration and data is replicated to the specified location. If replication is been enabled, location must be provided.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the replication.

createdDate.description: The last time when the replication was enabled.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time when the replication was updated.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the replication is enabled or not. When true, workspace configuration and data is replicated to the specified location.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the replication.

createdDate.description: The last time when the replication was enabled.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time when the replication was updated.

state.description: The failover state of the replication.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time when the failover state was updated.

PublicNetworkAccessType.description: The network access type for operating on the Log Analytics Workspace. By default it is Enabled

values.description: Enables connectivity to Log Analytics through public DNS.
Disables public connectivity to Log Analytics through public DNS.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

error.description: The error detail of the operation if any.

value.description: The system name of the metric.

localizedValue.description: The localized name of the metric.

unit.description: The units used for the metric.

currentValue.description: The current value of the metric.

limit.description: The quota limit for the metric.

nextResetTime.description: The time that the metric's value will reset.

created.description: The datetime that the management group was created.

dataReceived.description: The last datetime that the management group received data.

WorkspacePurgeBody.description: Describes the body of a purge request for an App Insights Workspace

table.description: Table from which to purge data.

filters.description: The set of columns and filters (queries) to run over them to purge the resulting data.

WorkspacePurgeBodyFilters.description: User-defined filters to return data which will be purged from the table.

column.description: The column of the table over which the given query should run

operator.description: A query operator to evaluate over the provided column and value(s). Supported operators are ==, =~, in, in~, >, >=, <, <=, between, and have the same behavior as they would in a KQL query.

value.description: the value for the operator to function over. This can be a number (e.g., > 100), a string (timestamp >= '2017-09-01') or array of values.

key.description: When filtering over custom dimensions, this key will be used as the name of the custom dimension.

WorkspacePurgeResponse.description: Response containing operationId for a specific purge action.

operationId.description: Id to use when querying for status for a particular purge operation.

WorkspacePurgeStatusResponse.description: Response containing status for a specific purge operation.

status.description: Status of the operation represented by the requested Id.

values.description: A string that matches the pattern of a URI, for example, scheme://username:password@host:1234/this/is/a/path?k1=v1&k2=v2#fragment
A standard 128-bit GUID following the standard shape, xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
An Azure Resource Model (ARM) path: /subscriptions/{...}/resourceGroups/{...}/providers/Microsoft.{...}/{...}/{...}/{...}...
A standard V4/V6 ip address following the standard shape, x.x.x.x/y:y:y:y:y:y:y:y

columns.description: A list of table custom columns.

standardColumns.description: A list of table standard columns.

values.description: Tables provisioned by the system, as collected via Diagnostic Settings, the Agents, or any other standard data collection means.
Tables created by the owner of the Workspace, and only found in this Workspace.
Standard data collected by Azure Monitor.
Custom log table.
Restored data.
Data collected by a search job.

tableSubType.description: The subtype describes what APIs can be used to interact with the table, and what features are available against it.

values.description: The default subtype with which built-in tables are created.
Indicates a table created through the Data Collector API or with the custom logs feature of the MMA agent, or any table against which Custom Fields were created.

A table eligible to have data sent into it via any of the means supported by Data Collection Rules: the Data Collection Endpoint API, ingestion-time transformations, or any other mechanism provided by Data Collection Rules

solutions.description: List of solutions the table is affiliated with

limit.description: Limit the search job to return up to specified number of rows.

startSearchTime.description: The timestamp to start the search from (UTC)

endSearchTime.description: The timestamp to end the search by (UTC)

sourceTable.description: The table used in the search job.

azureAsyncOperationId.description: Search results table async operation id.

SearchResults.description: Parameters of the search job that initiated this table.

startRestoreTime.description: The timestamp to start the restore from (UTC).

endRestoreTime.description: The timestamp to end the restore by (UTC).

sourceTable.description: The table to restore data from.

azureAsyncOperationId.description: Search results table async operation id.

ingestedRecords.description: The number of rows that were returned by the search job.

scannedGb.description: Search job: Amount of scanned data.

retentionInDays.description: The table retention in days, between 4 and 730. Setting this property to -1 will default to the workspace retention.

totalRetentionInDays.description: The table total retention in days, between 4 and 4383. Setting this property to -1 will default to table retention.

archiveRetentionInDays.description: The table data archive retention in days. Calculated as (totalRetentionInDays-retentionInDays)

searchResults.description: Parameters of the search job that initiated this table.

restoredLogs.description: Parameters of the restore operation that initiated this table.

plan.description: Instruct the system how to handle and charge the logs ingested to this table.

values.description: Logs that are adjusted to support high volume low value verbose logs.
Logs  that allow monitoring and analytics.

lastPlanModifiedDate.description: The timestamp that table plan was last modified (UTC).

provisioningState.description: Table's current provisioning state. If set to 'updating', indicates a resource lock due to ongoing operation, forbidding any update to the table until the ongoing operation is concluded.

values.description: Table schema is still being built and updated, table is currently locked for any changes till the procedure is done.
Table schema is stable and without changes, table data is being updated.
Table state is stable and without changes, table is unlocked and open for new updates.
Table state is deleting.

retentionInDaysAsDefault.description: True - Value originates from workspace retention in days, False - Customer specific.

totalRetentionInDaysAsDefault.description: True - Value originates from retention in days, False - Customer specific.

clusterId.description: The ID associated with the cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the cluster.

isDoubleEncryptionEnabled.description: Configures whether cluster will use double encryption. This Property can not be modified after cluster creation. Default value is 'true'

isAvailabilityZonesEnabled.description: Sets whether the cluster will support availability zones. This can be set as true only in regions where Azure Data Explorer support Availability Zones. This Property can not be modified after cluster creation. Default value is 'true' if region supports Availability Zones.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time the cluster was updated.

associatedWorkspaces.description: The list of Log Analytics workspaces associated with the cluster

ClusterPatch.description: The top level Log Analytics cluster resource container.

Cluster.description: The top level Log Analytics cluster resource container.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of recommendations.

value.description: A list of Log Analytics clusters.

keyVaultUri.description: The Key Vault uri which holds they key associated with the Log Analytics cluster.

keyName.description: The name of the key associated with the Log Analytics cluster.

keyVersion.description: The version of the key associated with the Log Analytics cluster.

billingType.description: Configures whether billing will be only on the cluster or each workspace will be billed by its proportional use. This does not change the overall billing, only how it will be distributed. Default value is 'Cluster'

capacity.description: The capacity reservation level in Gigabytes for this cluster.

AssociatedWorkspace.description: The list of Log Analytics workspaces associated with the cluster.

resourceId.description: Associated workspace arm resource id, in the form of: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/{workspaceName}.

lastSkuUpdate.description: The last time Sku was updated.

location.description: The secondary location of the replication. If replication is being enabled, enabled must be provided.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the replication is enabled or not. When true the cluster is replicate to the specified location.

isAvailabilityZonesEnabled.description: Should enable AvailabilityZones for the given replicated cluster

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the cluster replication.

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time the cluster's replication was updated.

properties.description: Properties that define an Log Analytics QueryPack-Query resource.

LogAnalyticsQueryPackQueryProperties.description: Properties that define an Log Analytics QueryPack-Query resource.

id.description: The unique ID of your application. This field cannot be changed.

displayName.description: Unique display name for your query within the Query Pack.

timeCreated.description: Creation Date for the Log Analytics Query, in ISO 8601 format.

timeModified.description: Last modified date of the Log Analytics Query, in ISO 8601 format.

author.description: Object Id of user creating the query.

related.description: The related metadata items for the function.

categories.description: The related categories for the function.

resourceTypes.description: The related resource types for the function.

solutions.description: The related Log Analytics solutions for the function.

properties.description: Additional properties that can be set for the query.

LogAnalyticsQueryPackQuerySearchProperti.description: Properties that define an Log Analytics QueryPack-Query search properties.

related.description: The related metadata items for the function.

categories.description: The related categories for the function.

resourceTypes.description: The related resource types for the function.

solutions.description: The related Log Analytics solutions for the function.

LogAnalyticsQueryPackQueryListResult.description: Describes the list of Log Analytics QueryPack-Query resources.

value.description: List of Log Analytics QueryPack Query definitions.

nextLink.description: The URI to get the next set of Log Analytics QueryPack definitions if too many QueryPack-Queries where returned in the result set.

DataExport.description: The top level data export resource container.

DataExportListResult.description: Result of the request to list data exports.

value.description: List of data export instances within a workspace..

tableNames.description: An array of tables to export, for example: [“Heartbeat, SecurityEvent”].

createdDate.description: The latest data export rule modification time.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date and time when the export was last modified.

resourceId.description: The destination resource ID. This can be copied from the Properties entry of the destination resource in Azure.

type.description: The type of the destination resource

eventHubName.description: Optional. Allows to define an Event Hub name. Not applicable when destination is Storage Account.

name.description: The name of the intelligence pack.

enabled.description: The enabled boolean for the intelligence pack.

displayName.description: The display name of the intelligence pack.

IntelligencePack.description: Intelligence Pack containing a string name and boolean indicating if it's enabled.

properties.description: The data source properties in raw json format, each kind of data source have it's own schema.

etag.description: The ETag of the data source.

DataSourceFilter.description: DataSource filter. Right now, only filter by kind is supported.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of datasources.

DataSourceListResult.description: The list data source by workspace operation response.

PublicNetworkAccess.description: Allow, disallow, or let network security perimeter configuration control public network access to the protected resource. Value is optional but if passed in, it must be 'Enabled', 'Disabled' or 'SecuredByPerimeter'.

values.description: Allows public network access to the resource
Disallows public network access to the resource
The network security perimeter configuration rules allow or disallow public network access to the resource. Requires an associated network security perimeter.

NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfigurationLis.description: Result of a list NSP (network security perimeter) configurations request.

value.description: Array of network security perimeter results.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of results.

NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfigurationPro.description: Provisioning state of a network security perimeter configuration that is being created or updated.

provisioningIssues.description: List of provisioning issues, if any

ProvisioningIssue.description: Describes a provisioning issue for a network security perimeter configuration

ProvisioningIssueProperties.description: Details of a provisioning issue for a network security perimeter (NSP) configuration. Resource providers should generate separate provisioning issue elements for each separate issue detected, and include a meaningful and distinctive description, as well as any appropriate suggestedResourceIds and suggestedAccessRules

values.description: Unknown issue type
An error occurred while applying the network security perimeter (NSP) configuration.
A network connectivity issue is happening on the resource which could be addressed either by adding new resources to the network security perimeter (NSP) or by modifying access rules.

An managed identity hasn't been associated with the resource. The resource will still be able to validate inbound traffic from the network security perimeter (NSP) or matching inbound access rules, but it won't be able to perform outbound access as a member of the NSP.

suggestedResourceIds.description: Fully qualified resource IDs of suggested resources that can be associated to the network security perimeter (NSP) to remediate the issue.

items.description: Fully qualified resource ID of the suggested resource

suggestedAccessRules.description: Access rules that can be added to the network security profile (NSP) to remediate the issue.

NetworkSecurityPerimeter.description: Information about a network security perimeter (NSP)

id.description: Fully qualified Azure resource ID of the NSP resource

perimeterGuid.description: Universal unique ID (UUID) of the network security perimeter

location.description: Location of the network security perimeter

ResourceAssociationAccessMode.description: Access mode of the resource association

values.description: Enforced access mode - traffic to the resource that failed access checks is blocked
Learning access mode - traffic to the resource is enabled for analysis but not blocked
Audit access mode - traffic to the resource that fails access checks is logged but not blocked

enabledLogCategories.description: List of log categories that are enabled

AccessRule.description: Access rule in a network security perimeter configuration profile

values.description: Applies to inbound network traffic to the secured resources.
Applies to outbound network traffic from the secured resources

addressPrefixes.description: Address prefixes in the CIDR format for inbound rules

items.description: An IP address prefix (CIDR) for inbound rules

id.description: The fully qualified Azure resource ID of the subscription e.g. ('/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000')

networkSecurityPerimeters.description: Network security perimeters for inbound rules

fullyQualifiedDomainNames.description: Fully qualified domain names (FQDN) for outbound rules

id.description: The Azure Resource Manager ID of the storage account resource.

state.description: The state of the storage insight connection to the workspace

description.description: Description of the state of the storage insight.

StorageInsightStatus.description: The status of the storage insight.

containers.description: The names of the blob containers that the workspace should read

tables.description: The names of the Azure tables that the workspace should read

status.description: The status of the storage insight

eTag.description: The ETag of the storage insight.

StorageInsight.description: The top level storage insight resource container.

value.description: A list of storage insight items.

@odata.nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

StorageInsightListResult.description: The list storage insights operation response.

primarySharedKey.description: The primary shared key of a workspace.

secondarySharedKey.description: The secondary shared key of a workspace.

SharedKeys.description: The shared keys for a workspace.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

AzureEntityResource.title: Entity Resource
AzureEntityResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager resource with an etag.

TrackedResource.title: Tracked Resource
TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ProxyResource.title: Proxy Resource
ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location

ResourceModelWithAllowedPropertySet.description: The resource model definition containing the full set of allowed properties for a resource. Except properties bag, there cannot be a top level property outside of this set.

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type. E.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. E.g. P3. It is typically a letter+number code

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

ErrorResponse.title: Error response
ErrorResponse.description: Common error response for all Azure Resource Manager APIs to return error details for failed operations. (This also follows the OData error response format.).

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

OperationStatusResult.description: The current status of an async operation.

id.description: Fully qualified ID for the async operation.

resourceId.description: Fully qualified ID of the resource against which the original async operation was started.

percentComplete.description: Percent of the operation that is complete.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

error.description: If present, details of the operation error.

locationData.description: Metadata pertaining to the geographic location of the resource.

name.description: A canonical name for the geographic or physical location.

city.description: The city or locality where the resource is located.

district.description: The district, state, or province where the resource is located.

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region where the resource is located

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

encryptionProperties.description: Configuration of key for data encryption

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

keyIdentifier.description: Key vault uri to access the encryption key.

identity.description: The client ID of the identity which will be used to access key vault.

name.description: The name of the resource for which availability needs to be checked.

nameAvailable.description: Indicates if the resource name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the given name is not available.

message.description: Detailed reason why the given name is available.

SkuTier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.
